Com_Talk_02c:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Sarq! Maybe I'll give this to my
husband later!
Com_Talk_90b: <sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Sarq! My husband will be happy too.
Com_Talk_90c:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Sarq!


If you want to do some cooking, you can
use a pot over there. You will have to light
the fire yourself though...
talk0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy>I'll try to bring back enough to survive
your shopping sprees!
talk0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>When that sand shroud was at its worst,
I thought it might be the endâ€”that I might
never see my husband again.
It reminded me that every day is
priceless, and I need to live them to
the fullest...
Com_Talk_53:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>Aw, you changed your mind? Even
though these fine ingredients were
lovingly gathered by my husband?
talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you're looking to do some cooking, you
can use the shared kitchen. It's right in
front of this shop.
Com_Talk_54:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>I...I'm sorry to be the bearer of bad news,
but... <sp:5:0:0>You don't have enough rupees.
Com_Talk_05c:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'd love to see something that would
delight my husband.
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>With the sand shroud finally dying down,
I was able to see my husband at last!

I thought I would be fully stocked for a
while, but it looks like I underestimated
your appetite for my wares, huh?
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>That's fine! <sp:5:0:0>It's an excuse to see my
husband again! Sarq!
Com_Talk_55:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal>You can't hold more than that...
Sell or throw some things away,
then you can try again.
Com_Talk_05d:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I like to share the things people sell me
with my husband too, so...sell me all
sorts of things!
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>My husband gathers all our products, so
the flavor and quality are guaranteed!
Com_Talk_15:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>What is that? <sp:5:0:0>Well, regardless, it's not
something I can handle.
Com_Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal>Huh? You're wanting to sell what you're
currently wearing?<sp:5:0:0> Sorry, but around
here, you have to change out of it first...
talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>Hey! You recently arrived, right?
Does that mean the sand shroud has
finally died down?
talk0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>With the sand shroud finally dying down,
I was able to see my husband at last!

Now the store is fully stocked, so buy as
much as you'd like!
Com_Talk_00: <sp:3:0:2:0700>All right, show me what you'd like to sell.
GreetingAfter03:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:CustomVasaaq>Vasaaq!<sp:5:0:0>


My husband gathers all of our products,
so I can personally vouch for their flavor
and quality!
talk0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Oh, hang on...<sp:5:0:0> Now that I really look, I can
see all the sand covering your clothes...

What was I thinking? If the sand shroud
really was gone, I doubt everyone would
still be hanging around...<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Ugh, sorry. I asked you a question, and
then immediately went on my own little
journey there.
Ever since the sand shroud started,
I haven't been able to see my husband.
It's left me a little frazzled.
talk0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm sorry my selection is what it is...


Because of this sand shroud, I can't get
word to my husband to let him know what
we need to restock...
talk0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I wonder if he has anything left...<sp:5:1:0>


I want to let my husband know what
the store needs, but as long as this
sand shroud continues...
GreetingBefore03:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:CustomVasaaq>Vasaaq...<sp:5:0:0>


My husband gathers all of our products,
so I can personally vouch for their flavor
and quality.
Com_Talk_04: <sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:QuestionNormal>Uh, you changed your mind? Oh, well.
talk0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I know my stock is pretty limited, but...


Here's a tip! You can make an excellent
meal just by adding a mushroom to some
Hylian rice and rock salt!
Com_Talk_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Is there anything else you want to
sell me?
talk0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you're looking to do some cooking, you
can use the shared kitchen. It's down the
path flanked by palm trees.
talk0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Sarq!


If you want to do some cooking, you can
use the pot in the shared kitchen. It's at
the end of the path with the palm trees.
talk0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm surprised you were able to travel at
all in that storm. You must be exhausted.

You know, in times like these, it's really
important to keep your strength up.
And you can do that by eating right!
My husband gathers all our products, so
the flavor and quality are guaranteed!
Com_Talk_31: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>How many should I wrap up for you?
Com_Talk_91a:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Sarq! I'll have to ask my husband to
collect some more!
